member.name: begin
member.desc: Begins emulating the mouse connected to a computer. begin() must be called before controlling the computer. To end control, use Mouse.end().

member.name: click
member.desc: Sends a momentary click to the computer at the location of the cursor. This is the same as pressing and immediately releasing the mouse button. Mouse.click() defaults to the left mouse button.
member.param: which mouse button to press. Allowed data types: char.

member.name: end
member.desc: Stops emulating the mouse connected to a computer. To start control, use Mouse.begin().

member.name: move
member.desc: Moves the cursor on a connected computer. The motion onscreen is always relative to the cursorâ€™s current location. Before using Mouse.move() you must call Mouse.begin()
member.param: amount to move along the x-axis. Allowed data types: signed char.
amount to move along the y-axis. Allowed data types: signed char.
amount to move scroll wheel. Allowed data types: signed char.

member.name: press
member.desc: Sends a button press to a connected computer. A press is the equivalent of clicking and continuously holding the mouse button. A press is cancelled with Mouse.release(). Before using Mouse.press(), you need to start communication with Mouse.begin(). Mouse.press() defaults to a left button press.
member.param: which mouse button to press. Allowed data types: char.

member.name: release
member.desc: Sends a message that a previously pressed button (invoked through Mouse.press()) is released. Mouse.release() defaults to the left button.
member.param: which mouse button to press. Allowed data types: char.

member.name: isPressed
member.desc: Checks the current status of all mouse buttons, and reports if any are pressed or not.
member.returns: Reports whether a button is pressed or not. Data type: bool.
member.param: which mouse button to check. Allowed data types: char.
